column5: Well...after catching nothing in about 8 outings, my skunk was finally broken....thanks to the expertise of CANADIAN COPPER.  We headed out on a "crisp" morning.  CRISP being an understatement.  It was a balmy -17C (-24C with the windchill).  Good thing it wasn't windy where we were....not that it mattered THAT much...LOL.  I remember back in October saying "as soon as it goes below zero, my fishing season is over".  Anyhow, we arrived at our spot bright and early...around 6:15am.  He blindfolded me...even though I had to drive...he just gave directions.  It was still dark out and for some reason no one else was around..haha.  I wasn't quite sure where the water was, because of the ice fog coming off of it!!  The visibility was around a foot and we had our lines in the water, using roe.  By 8am, I had a hit...FISH ON!!!  I fought him, and eventually brought him close, with CANADIAN COPPER manning the net.  Just as he went to reach for it, it rolled and snapped my line.  We figure it was a nice 8 pounder that got away.  A little while later, I had yet another hit.  This was a little guy, so I managed to land him farily quickly.  Here's the chromie that ended my skunk.    No, the fish didn't instantly freeze when he came out of the water....hehe...that's snow on him.  He was back in the water about 2 minutes after he came out of the water....just time for a quick pic and back in.  CANADIAN COPPER then finally landed this 7 pounder on a jig.  He was getting a little concerned because me...the newbie already landed one and lost one...this was his first hit all day long.    Anyhow, I had one last hit around noon....and then promptly lost him...using a pink worm.  Thanks CANADIAN COPPER....for taking me under your wing...and teaching me the ropes.  Also for the use of the equipment and the company.  I'll be calling you again soon I'm sure!!!  PS...gotta go to the ER....should get those black toes looked at....they just dont feel right....LOL  j/k
way to go cliff,you finally got a nice rainbow.  ..thats a nice report & pics guys ...well now you have the fever for trout cliff...your hooked now...cheers
Nice to see you finally got one
Nice one!  I'm still getting use to your "day" reports

WAS BURR OUTING INDEED BRO BUT WE SURVIVED!!!(THANK GOD FOR TIMMIES  LOL)  CLIFFS A GREAT GUY TO FISH WITH (EVEN IF HE HOGGED MOST OF THE FISH  LOL)  DO IT AGAIN FOR SURE BRO!!! REMIND THE WIFE I'LL NEED THOSE PHOTO'S AGAIN NEXT OUTING  LOL

Thanks for getting him out of my hair for the day CC!  Glad to help out with the photos, I'll keep them handy.  I must confess, I am a bit jealous that I had to stay home and tend to the children, maybe another time  blyght
Atta boy !  Scott sure knows where they live ... I think I recognized that strecth of snow
Dang you guys are hard core...good stuff!  Maureen
Good one Cliff and ya had a good net guy...
Nice fish, looks pretty cold out there. Good for you guys for getting out  and getting one!
thats great Cliff, wtg!
Great report Cliff and congrats. A smart dude fishing with a smart pro....it's a no brainer, they'll do'er every time.
WTG Cliff for ending your drought!
anytime blyght!!! just dont hog the fish like cliff did!!! i gave him the sweet spot since it was his first outing!!! now he knows enough so its a free for all now  LOL!!!
Nice report... the cold sure didnt stop you from getting int some ice cold steel..
Nice steelies.W2G It is always nice to learn from some one who can teach u alot.    jordan
Great work Guys!  I remember how long my first Steelie was in coming...  Course that was 20 years ago! Dam I'm gettin' old!
Hmm strange Copper usually has his fish clean showing all its colors and siver!  No sugar coating on it.  Or is is batter ready for the frier, guts and all!!   dsn
Right on Cliff!  Nice  Joey
Attaboy Cliff!. Congrats. Way to go CC!
Thanks everyone....I was beginning to think I'd never catch one.  They are scrappy fish and I can see why it's so addicting!
Good job now can we get somemore videos of the band now that you got that out of the way,I enjoyed the last one.If you guys are ever in brantford let me know.   JER
Congrats on the first chrome!  Mike
